intro: Cryptantha lappula, commonly known as the lappula bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is native to the western United States, particularly California, and thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought tolerance. Cryptantha lappula is also known for its medicinal properties, historically used by indigenous peoples for various health purposes.
